Liz Abinante

The world's peppiest web developer.

Hello! My name is Liz Abinante.

I like to make things. I knit, I write code, and I bake. I am a big fan of the Oxford comma. My super powers include knitting, designing, freakishly fast hand raising, speed-reading, and selecting perfectly ripe fruits and vegetables. I am also great at DIY crafts and braiding hair.

I'm passionate about diversity in engineering. I like to talk about what it means to be a minority in engineering. I love sharing my experiences with newcomers to programming, and enjoy the cycle of teaching and learning that is such a huge part of hacking.

I gained my programming foundation at Dev Bootcamp, which I graduated from in July 2013. Currently, I am a Software Engineer at Instructure.

I live in Chicago, originally hailing from the best coast (California, obviously).

I am still getting used to the snow, but I really love it here.
